intro: Tococa nitens var. weddellii, commonly known as the Weddell's tococa, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a climbing plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the region's biodiversity.
